main.name: Claire Gantan
main.description: Computer Science and Electrical Engineering Undergraduate Student
main.bio: I am a computer engineer focused on the intersection of hardware and software, specifically computer architecture and robotics. I am passionate about making a difference, mainly through creating programs that teach underrepresented students about the world of STEM through an online curriculum.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: B.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
education.description: Coursework includes: Structure & Interpretation of Computer Programs, Data Structures, Designing Information Devices & Systems, Multivariable & Vector Calculus, Machine Structures, Discrete Mathematics & Probability Theory, Social Implications of Computer Technology, and Computer Architecture and Engineering

work.title: Computer Science Instructor
work.description: Responsible for developing ongoing learning plans for K-12 students (case load - 6 students) and conducting weekly individualized programming lessons specializing in Scratch, Python and Java

work.company: USC Alfred Mann Institute of Biomedical Engineering
work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Optimized a system for automated recognition of drugs comprising of a computational neural network trained using normal visible and hyperspectral images, developed a wireframe design for the app, and expanded the knowledge base of computer learning system via 10k+ prepared images.

work.company: UC Berkeley Translational Applications of Nanoscale Multiferroic Systems
work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Developed and conducted input impedance simulations using COMSOL Multiphysics for acoustically-driven ferromagnetic resonance in High Overtone Bulk Acoustic Resonators (HBAR) in the Salahuddin Lab.

work.title: High School Research Intern
work.description: Enhanced Photon Microscope via Confocal Line Detection software in LabVIEW, prototyped, programmed and tested an Optical Coherence Tomography(OCT) device, and initiated the implementation of Github version control to the OCT project.
